pullRequest.body:
When dealing with the mixed space, a lot of results depend on whether the infinite place considered is real or is complex and thus are duplicated using the ending `apply_of_isReal` or `apply_of_isComplex` in their names. However, the spelling `apply_ofIsReal` or `apply_ofIsComplex` was also used for some results. 

This PR attempts to fix this confusion using the following convention:
- If the fact that the infinite place is real or complex comes from an additional hypothesis, use `apply_of_isReal`/`apply_of_isComplex`
- If the fact that the infinite place is real or complex comes from a subtype, use `apply_isReal` / `apply_isComplex`



---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [e2f8493549](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21629/commits/e2f849354937e318aeee5e794ba14b9a051ddf76)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ indexEquiv_apply_isComplex_fst`
`+ indexEquiv_apply_isComplex_snd`
`+ indexEquiv_apply_isReal`
`+ mixedEmbedding_apply_isComplex`
`+ mixedEmbedding_apply_isReal`
`+ negAt_apply_abs_isReal`
`+ negAt_apply_isComplex`
`+ negAt_apply_isReal_and_mem`
`+ negAt_apply_isReal_and_not_mem`
`+ negAt_signSet_apply_isComplex`
`+ negAt_signSet_apply_isReal`
`+ normAtPlace_apply_of_isComplex`
`+ normAtPlace_apply_of_isReal`
`+ stdBasis_apply_isComplex_fst`
`+ stdBasis_apply_isComplex_snd`
`+ stdBasis_apply_isReal`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Does the `ofIsReal` variant for subtypes have a precedent somewhere?
I think it makes sense to try to distinguish the two cases, but it would be good to discuss this on Zulip if this is not yet used somewhere else in a similar way.

The old names should probably be deprecated.

> Does the `ofIsReal` variant for subtypes have a precedent somewhere? I think it makes sense to try to distinguish the two cases, but it would be good to discuss this on Zulip if this is not yet used somewhere else in a similar way.
> 
> The old names should probably be deprecated.

Yes, you are right. I'll make a thread to ask on Zulip (and I'll try to remember to add deprecations alias too).

Thanks

@MichaelStollBayreuth, it seems that the Zulip thread did not get much feedback. I looked at Mathlib but didn't really find any hint on what would be the proper naming convention is this situation. I do not mind changing everything to use `of_isReal/of_isComplex` if you think it is more consistent.

[Zulip message](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Naming.20convention/near/498947067).

I have repeated the request for comments on Zulip. If nothing happens for a few more days, it is probably fine to go ahead with this.

> [Zulip message](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Naming.20convention/near/498947067).
> 
> I have repeated the request for comments on Zulip. If nothing happens for a few more days, it is probably fine to go ahead with this.

@MichaelStollBayreuth Well, this question was very unsuccessful, I am afraid. So we'll have to decide by ourselves...

Last chance for the maintainers to make their opnions known!
maintainer merge?
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by MichaelStollBayreuth.

:v: xroblot can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13596159852/job/38013429520)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13596159852/job/38013429808)

Sorry for missing the zulip conversation. My suggestion would be to drop the `of`
```suggestion
theorem negAt_apply_IsReal_and_mem (x : mixedSpace K) {w : {w // IsReal w}} (hw : w âˆˆ s) :
```
But it's only a mild gut feeling, not a strong opinion.
Have you considered this?

Anyway, I don't want to hold up the PR over this.

bors d+
I can live with that (and it makes the name shorter :)). Thanks!
@jcommelin, just to be sure, should it be `negAt_apply_IsReal_and_mem` or `negAt_apply_isReal_and_mem`?
Naming convention says `isReal` so I'll go with that.
But, then it's really similar to the names used in the other case.. So, in the end, I think I'll use `ofIsReal` and `ofIsComplex`.
Well, in the end, I decided to go with Johan's suggestion but with lower camel case. Sorry for all the hesitation and the noise

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(NumberField/CanonicalEmbedding): Fix naming
